content:
• Thursday, March 15, 2012
  • COMV

    More on Comverge (NASDAQ:COMV): Q4 beats across the board despite a decline in revenue, as...

    More on Comverge (NASDAQ:COMV): Q4 beats across the board despite a decline in revenue, as better gross margins and the removal of $4.1M in expenses helped shore up its bottom line. Shares +7.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q4 EPS of $0.98 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $123M (+32.2% Y/Y)....

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q4 EPS of $0.98 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $123M (+32.2% Y/Y). Shares +15.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • DOLE

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) Q4 beats on a per share basis, largely due to ongoing cost-cutting...

    More on Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE) Q4 beats on a per share basis, largely due to ongoing cost-cutting efforts. Cost reduction programs set forth in the past two years have helped improve earnings, despite increasing input costs and the strength of foreign currencies. Shares +2.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -1.4% AH after lowering Q1 guidance to a loss of $0.11-$0.15/share vs....

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -1.4% AH after lowering Q1 guidance to a loss of $0.11-$0.15/share vs. a $0.03 consensus gain, based in part of a LIFO credit that would be lower than Q4's LIFO credit. AKS expects shipments of ~1.3M tons in Q1, ~7% lower Q/Q, but sees average per-ton selling price for Q1 ~6% higher Q/Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • VIEW

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Cogo Group (COGO) announces chairman and CEO Jeffrey Kang has...

    In tandem with its Q4 report, Cogo Group (COGO) announces chairman and CEO Jeffrey Kang has proposed to acquire roughly 30% of the company's "total assets, liabilities, and revenue" for a price of $60M-$82M. Kang would continue to serve as chairman and CEO following the deal's closing. Cogo, which closed trading with a market cap of just $66.4M, is up 74.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • VIEW

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $169.5M (+49% Y/Y) beats by $22M....

    Cogo Group (COGO): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $169.5M (+49% Y/Y) beats by $22M. Shares +62.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • ACHV

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI +7.6%) falls 12.3% AH after filing for a stock offering...

    OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals (OGXI +7.6%) falls 12.3% AH after filing for a stock offering featuring an undisclosed number of shares. The company plans to partly use the proceeds to develop its OGX-427 cancer drug, and possibly other drug candidates.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • COMV

    Comverge (NASDAQ:COMV): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $36.7M (-1.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Comverge (NASDAQ:COMV): Q4 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $36.7M (-1.3% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • DOLE

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.54B (-1.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    Dole Food (NYSE:DOLE): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $1.54B (-1.3% Y/Y) misses by $30M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • PRMW

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q4 EPS of -$0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $22M (+73% Y/Y) in-line....

    Primo Water (NASDAQ:PRMW): Q4 EPS of -$0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $22M (+73% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -5.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • ENOC

    Electricity services firm EnerNOC (ENOC +5%) bounces off its 52-week low after Capstone upgrades...

    Electricity services firm EnerNOC (ENOC +5%) bounces off its 52-week low after Capstone upgrades shares to Hold. Shares appear to have received an additional lift in afternoon trading following the posting of the company's 10-K. EnerNOC was hammered last month after providing weak guidance to go with its Q4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +7.2%) shares are upgraded to Outperform by JMP Securities on signs that the...

    NuVasive (NUVA +7.2%) shares are upgraded to Outperform by JMP Securities on signs that the fundamentals of the slumping market for spine products have turned a corner. The firm says NUVA is well positioned to benefit from what should prove a long-term trend because of its focus on minimally invasive surgery and its acquisition of Impulse Monitoring.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • QCOM

    More findings from the iFixit iPad teardown: QCOM (+0.1%) power management IC; LCD believed to...

    More findings from the iFixit iPad teardown: QCOM (+0.1%) power management IC; LCD believed to be from Samsung; TXN (+2.4%) driver device, FCS (+4.4%) filter chip; Elpida DRAM and flash memory from Toshiba; power management chip probably from CRUS (+1.7%); quad-band linear power amplifier module from TQNT (+1.9%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • CVX

    Brazil's top oil regulator says that a new oil leak was discovered close to the site of last...

    Brazil's top oil regulator says that a new oil leak was discovered close to the site of last year's spill resulting from Chevron's (CVX -1.1%) drilling operations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • FLT

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +4.6%) shares jump after announcing the renewal of its commercial...

    FleetCor Technologies (FLT +4.6%) shares jump after announcing the renewal of its commercial fleet card contract with The Pantry, operator of a southeastern U.S. convenience store chain with ~1,620 stores. FLT has been managing The Pantry's fleet card portfolio for more than 10 years.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • EBAY

    PayPal officially unveils PayPal Here, an anticipated mobile payment solution that takes aim at...

    PayPal officially unveils PayPal Here, an anticipated mobile payment solution that takes aim at Square. Leveraging a triangle-shaped dongle and mobile apps, PayPal says its offering, which it will push to its 100M+ customers, comes with a debit card that gives merchants 1% cash-back on some purchases, potentially lowering its rate to 1.7%. The news isn't helping eBay (EBAY -2.1%) shares, which remain pressured by a Credit Suisse downgrade.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • LDOS

    SAIC (SAI +1.8%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Lazard Capital, citing its CityTime settlement...

    SAIC (SAI +1.8%) gains on an upgrade to Buy at Lazard Capital, citing its CityTime settlement and operational improvements.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • OMG

    Shares of specialty chemicals maker OM Group (OMG +9%) are upgraded to Overweight with a $39...

    Shares of specialty chemicals maker OM Group (OMG +9%) are upgraded to Overweight with a $39 price target at First Analysis, primarily on valuation. The firm believes renewed marketing focus could gain traction with investors "hunting in the chemicals/materials bargain bin."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • SEH

    Spartech (SEH -7.6%) swings to a FQ1 loss, as the packaging company reports higher expenses and...

    Spartech (SEH -7.6%) swings to a FQ1 loss, as the packaging company reports higher expenses and as year-ago results included a bigger gain from discontinued operations. SEH says slow and uncertain demand recovery in markets it serves and a dynamic raw materials market may impact future results.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI +5.5%) is surging on iPad review day; expectations are up the new iPad features...

    OmniVision (OVTI +5.5%) is surging on iPad review day; expectations are up the new iPad features one or more OmniVision sensors. iFixit doesn't mention OmniVision in its iPad 4G teardown, though it does note the existence of a Broadcom (BRCM +2%) combo chip, I/O controller, and touchscreen controller, and (like the iPhone 4S) a Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) transceiver chip. No word on the expected Qualcomm baseband chip. Update: iFixit has completed its teardown and notes a Qualcomm baseband is present, among other parts.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSC

    A slow coal recovery will inhibit Norfolk Southern (NSC +5.7%) and CSX (CSX +7.7%) "for several...

    A slow coal recovery will inhibit Norfolk Southern (NSC +5.7%) and CSX (CSX +7.7%) "for several quarters," Barclays says, but "solid pricing fundamentals and relatively stable western coal dynamics create a bright outlook" for Union Pacific (UNP +5.9%). The firm stays bullish on CSX since "a lower valuation and forecast cost reductions this year provide some buffer."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • HMST

    HomeStreet (HMST +3.2%) says its CFO David E. Hooston will leave the company at the end of the...

    HomeStreet (HMST +3.2%) says its CFO David E. Hooston will leave the company at the end of the month, and it's begun the search for a successor.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4%) makes new 52-week highs after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy. The firm...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4%) makes new 52-week highs after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy. The firm expects Affymax's Peginesatide dialysis drug, which is set for a Q2 launch, to be "a disruptive force" in its target market, one that will put an end to the "monopoly pricing power" wielded by Amgen's (NASDAQ:AMGN) Epogen.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks (AMCX -5.3%) trades lower after posting a big miss on its Q4 EPS. Revenue actually...

    AMC Networks (AMCX -5.3%) trades lower after posting a big miss on its Q4 EPS. Revenue actually jumped 13% Y/Y, but profit lagged as the cable network owner took a hit on higher interest expenses, write-downs from a canceled series and higher marketing expenses from "Mad Men" and "The Killing."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • BREW

    Craft Brew (HOOK) plans to trade under the symbol BREW starting March 22 in a move that the...

    Craft Brew (HOOK) plans to trade under the symbol BREW starting March 22 in a move that the company says will better convey its corporate mission. Shares of HOOK are down 3.1% on the day after the company misses the consensus estimate of analysts with its full year 2011 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.5%) shares rise amid news China Unicom (CHU +1.7%) launched internet...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +2.5%) shares rise amid news China Unicom (CHU +1.7%) launched internet service for BlackBerry users. The gain comes despite an MKM report pointing to channel checks which note "abnormally" high warranty returns at Verizon for BlackBerry 7 models; many are said to lock up right out of the box and need immediate replacement.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (CPE +2.7%) trades higher after its Q4 earnings easily beat estimates. Profit...

    Callon Petroleum (CPE +2.7%) trades higher after its Q4 earnings easily beat estimates. Profit soared Y/Y, boosted by a one-time income-tax benefit and higher-than-expected oil revenues. The company's earnings have consistently risen over the past year as the oil-and-gas producer continues to diversify its reserves and reduce its exposure to offshore drilling in the Gulf of Mexico.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • AMRN

    Sparking gains in Irish biotech firm Amarin (AMRN +8.6%) is a Leerink Swann note speculating...

    Sparking gains in Irish biotech firm Amarin (AMRN +8.6%) is a Leerink Swann note speculating that "patent progress could solidify Amarin as a prime takeout candidate given the blockbuster potential for [heart-drug candidate] AMR-101." The firm had earlier said AMRN was moving toward winning its quest for U.S. patent protection for AMR-101.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.9%) cuts the price of its Nook customers shopping with a MasterCard by...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS -1.9%) cuts the price of its Nook customers shopping with a MasterCard by $20 in a preemptive strike ahead of Friday's launch of the next iPad. Is it too little too late? Earlier this week, IDC's latest estimates of tablet and e-reader shipments didn't paint a pretty picture for the prospect of Barnes & Noble gaining market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN +4%) rallies in spite of issuing a major warning. Due to soft carrier orders, the...

    Adtran (ADTN +4%) rallies in spite of issuing a major warning. Due to soft carrier orders, the telecom equipment maker now expects Q1 revenue of $130M-$135M and EPS of $0.22-$0.25, well below a consensus of $174.7M and $0.44. However, Adtran, which had already seen a raft of negative analyst notes (I, II, III), says order rates have "substantially improved" in March. Possibly up in sympathy: JNPR +3.3%. CIEN +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR -5.7%) slump after the gaming company announces a $500M...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR -5.7%) slump after the gaming company announces a $500M offering of its common stock. Though shares of Caesars haven't had a problem staying above their IPO price of $9, they also haven't regained the heights seen on the first day of active trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • AIXXF

    Deutsche's upgrade of Aixtron (AIXG +14.6%) and Veeco Instruments (VECO +10.9%) appears to be...

    Deutsche's upgrade of Aixtron (AIXG +14.6%) and Veeco Instruments (VECO +10.9%) appears to be giving a lift to other LED industry names. CREE +5%. RBCN +4.1%. LEDS +9.5%. Also helping is a positive UBS note, in which the firm says Cree is likely to benefit from a new federal mandate requiring agencies to spend a minimum of $2B over the next 2 years to make their facilities more energy-efficient.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -7%) plummets despite Q4 results that show earnings and revenues ahead of...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -7%) plummets despite Q4 results that show earnings and revenues ahead of analyst estimates. The provider of video management software warns it does not expect to generate positive free cash flow in Q1 due to additional investments in the business, and says temporary cash outlays will be required to support large client implementations.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM

  • The U.S. and U.K. have agreed to release emergency oil stocks, reports Reuters. Brent Crude...

    The U.S. and U.K. have agreed to release emergency oil stocks, reports Reuters. Brent Crude (BNO) -2%, WTI Crude (USO) -1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 14 Comments
  • AIZ

    Assurant (AIZ -2.9%) posts the S&P 500's biggest decline after California Insurance...

    Assurant (AIZ -2.9%) posts the S&P 500's biggest decline after California Insurance Commissioner Dave Jones told insurers to lower rates for clients who lapsed on their previous residential policies. Jones said yesterday he contacted the 10 largest "lender-placed coverage" insurers in the state about his demand and told them to respond by April 1.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • UBS

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) reaches agreement in principle with a monoline insurer - believed to be MBIA (MBI...

    UBS (NYSE:UBS) reaches agreement in principle with a monoline insurer - believed to be MBIA (MBI +4.7%), although the name is not provided in the SEC filing - under which UBS agreed to the commutation of certain credit default swap contracts in exchange for a net cash payment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • ITMN

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN +8.8%) run higher after the company announces that its lung disease...

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN +8.8%) run higher after the company announces that its lung disease drug Esbriet gained approval with a Germany review committee. The action clears a path for the treatment to be approved by the nation's health insurers and helps increase confidence that France will also allow the therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD +2.5%) plans to close 62 more stores in the first half of this year, in addition to...

    Sears (SHLD +2.5%) plans to close 62 more stores in the first half of this year, in addition to the ~120 poorly performing Sears and Kmart stores the retailer has already announced it will close. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 7 Comments
  • LVLT

    Level 3 (LVLT +4.7%) jumps on an upgrade to Buy from BofA. The firm claims Level 3 has the best...

    Level 3 (LVLT +4.7%) jumps on an upgrade to Buy from BofA. The firm claims Level 3 has the best risk/reward among the "alternative carriers" it covers, and expects revenue growth in its Core Network Services business, along with the company's operating leverage and synergies from the Global Crossing acquisition, to drive shares higher.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • WGO

    Winnebago (WGO +7.4%) shares jump after sinking 4% premarket and despite a surprise FQ2 loss....

    Winnebago (WGO +7.4%) shares jump after sinking 4% premarket and despite a surprise FQ2 loss. Quarter results were hit by increased discounts and continued aggressive pricing strategies, but the RV maker says it has a strong order backlog. WGO says it's optimistic about economic growth, despite pump prices near $4/gallon.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • VTRAF

    Viterra (OTC:VTRAF) moves up 9% in Toronto before a trading halt screeches the advance to a...

    Viterra (OTC:VTRAF) moves up 9% in Toronto before a trading halt screeches the advance to a stop. Potential acquirers for the company will have to offer at least $16.13 a share to get a chance to access the firm's data, according to dealReporter. Bidders include Archer Daniels Midland (NYSE:ADM), Noble Group, Bunge (NYSE:BG), and Glencore (GLFCNF.PK).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • SYNC

    Newly-public Synacor (SYNC +5.5%) rallies following Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) purchase of NDS (I,...

    Newly-public Synacor (SYNC +5.5%) rallies following Cisco's (NASDAQ:CSCO) purchase of NDS (I, II). There could be some hopes that Synacor, whose software enables pay-TV providers to deliver web-based video, will also be an M&A target following the deal. On the flip side, cable infrastructure hardware/software vendor Harmonic (HLIT -3%) is selling off.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • BTU

    Shares of Peabody Energy (BTU +3.8%) jump higher on reports that Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A...

    Shares of Peabody Energy (BTU +3.8%) jump higher on reports that Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A +0.2%) is seeking a buyout of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ARCH

    Shares of coal companies outperform as a group after economic data and M&A chatter helps take a...

    Shares of coal companies outperform as a group after economic data and M&A chatter helps take a bit of the stink off the sector. Gainers: ACI +4.7%, PCX +4.6%, BTU +3.7%, ANR +4.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO +6%) shares move on comments from executive Jens Jensen that the oil tanker...

    Frontline (FRO +6%) shares move on comments from executive Jens Jensen that the oil tanker market has picked up sharply in recent weeks, helped by high activity from ships transporting oil to China. "We see an incredible amount of fixtures from the Persian Gulf at the moment, so there is really a lot of activity in the tanker market," Jensen says.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • SCHL

    Shares of Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) power up a 22.2% gain after reporting a significantly slimmer...

    Shares of Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) power up a 22.2% gain after reporting a significantly slimmer loss than expected in FQ3 - helped by the runaway success of The Hunger Games trilogy that continues to drive profits. For 2012, the company expects total revenue of approximately $2.0B and EPS to fall between $2.60 and $2.90.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • GLBR

    FXCM (FXCM +2.9%) catches a bid after being upgraded to Buy at Citigroup, citing a boost in...

    FXCM (FXCM +2.9%) catches a bid after being upgraded to Buy at Citigroup, citing a boost in institutional trading and increasing deal probability amid industry consolidation. The firm also raises its price target to $15 from $10.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • SCKT

    Socket Mobile (SCKT +48.8%) shares skyrocket after announcing that the Socket Bluetooth Cordless...

    Socket Mobile (SCKT +48.8%) shares skyrocket after announcing that the Socket Bluetooth Cordless Hand Scanner 7Ci barcode scanner has been certified by Apple for the iPad, iPhone and iPod touch.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +3.2%) rises after striking a deal to develop battery packs for a plug-in...

    A123 Systems (AONE +3.2%) rises after striking a deal to develop battery packs for a plug-in hybrid sedan to be manufactured by Chinese automaker Geely. The car is expected to launch in China in 2014. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • AVDL

    Flamel Technologies (FLML) -19% premarket after agreeing to acquire specialty drug maker Eclat...

    Flamel Technologies (FLML) -19% premarket after agreeing to acquire specialty drug maker Eclat Pharmaceuticals in a debt-and-warrant deal and named Eclat's chief executive to replace its own CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • ITMN

    Premarket gainers: ITMN +15%. NCT +9%. FRO +6%. MBI +5%. RVSN +5%. STM +4%. CREE +3%. FCEL +3%....

    Premarket gainers: ITMN +15%. NCT +9%. FRO +6%. MBI +5%. RVSN +5%. STM +4%. CREE +3%. FCEL +3%. HMC +3%. AMD +3%.
    Losers: GES -11%. YONG -11%. VRA -5%. PER -5%. GBG -4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX): Q4 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $339M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats...

    AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX): Q4 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.20. Revenue of $339M (+13.6% Y/Y) beats by $11M. Shares -2.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • AIXXF

    Aixtron (AIXG) and Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO) +13% and +6.5% premarket, respectively, after...

    Aixtron (AIXG) and Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO) +13% and +6.5% premarket, respectively, after Deutsche Bank upgrades shares of each, citing attractive risk/reward and expectations for orders to pick up. The firm believes fundamentals for MOCVD equipment suppliers are improving.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • AMD

    Jefferies sees a big upside for Advanced Micro (NASDAQ:AMD), upgrading shares to Buy with its...

    Jefferies sees a big upside for Advanced Micro (NASDAQ:AMD), upgrading shares to Buy with its target price raised to $10.50 from $7. “AMD offers one of the best risk/reward ratios in semis,” the firm writes. "We think share gains continue, and improving manufacturing yields could translate to upside surprises.” AMD +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • NBL

    Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) signs a 15-year gas sales agreement with Israel Electric to sell natural...

    Noble Energy (NYSE:NBL) signs a 15-year gas sales agreement with Israel Electric to sell natural gas from the Tamar field off the Israeli coast. Estimated revenue could total $18B-$23B, according to NBL, which has a 36% working interest in Tamar as its operator. NBL +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • ROST

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST): Q4 EPS of $0.85 in-line. Revenue of $2.4B (+11.8% Y/Y) in-line....

    Ross Stores (NASDAQ:ROST): Q4 EPS of $0.85 in-line. Revenue of $2.4B (+11.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares -2.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM
  • SINA

    New rules in China that require microbloggers to register under their real names will make...

    New rules in China that require microbloggers to register under their real names will make Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) Weibo service more attractive to advertisers, say analysts. Information on user identities will help weed out spam and provide a wealth of data that can be mined for marketing purposes. SINA +1.1% premarket, +38.9% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM
  • VRA

    Jefferies scolds Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) for its "uninspiring" outlook and clips its price...

    Jefferies scolds Vera Bradley (NASDAQ:VRA) for its "uninspiring" outlook and clips its price target on shares by $5 to take it down to $45. Analyst Randal Konik warns that the stock may move lower in the short-term due to concerns over spring selling trends, but maintains his Buy rating on the long-term potential of VRA to break out of its growth slump. Shares -5.8% premarket after reporting earnings AH yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:43 AM
  • WMS-OLD

    Goldman Sachs clips its rating on WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD) to Sell from Neutral after a...

    Goldman Sachs clips its rating on WMS Industries (NYSE:WMS-OLD) to Sell from Neutral after a survey of demand for slot machines came in on the weak side. Analysts lowered their earnings estimates for FY12 through FY14 and set a price target of $19. Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM
